target_text: "I’d like to say, in our team we also focus on the internal software quality. The final product may confirm to business needs and have fewer defects but it doesn’t always mean the internal quality is acceptable. We have to add the desires to maintain, understand and reuse code to evaluate quality."

Codebook.Definition: States that the team emphasizes internal aspects of software quality, not just outward results.
Asserts that meeting business needs and having fewer defects does not guarantee acceptable internal quality.

Codebook.Code: Business Fit and Low Defects Acknowledged
Codebook.Definition: Recognizes outcomes where the product conforms to business requirements and exhibits fewer defects.
Identifies the ability to maintain code as a desired attribute to assess software quality.
Identifies code understandability as a desired attribute to assess software quality.
Identifies the potential to reuse code as a desired attribute to assess software quality.
Calls for incorporating maintainability, understandability, and reusability into the overall quality evaluation.
